BspUtils_Ub960SourceI2cAddr Struct Reference
Sample Example API » Sample Example - Utility library API » APIs to initialize and de-initialize UB960 EVM

Configure I2C address of the sources When numDetected > 0, indicates UB960 EVM is initialized. When numDetected == 0, indicates UB960 EVM did not detect any sources. Please check the I2C addresses in case a source was connected but not detected. More...

#include <bsputils_ub960.h>

Data Fields

UInt32 slaveAddr
 
UInt32 numSource
 
UInt32 rSlave1Addr [BSPUTILS_UB960EVM_MAX_PORTS]
 
UInt32 rSlave2Addr [BSPUTILS_UB960EVM_MAX_PORTS]
 

Detailed Description

Configure I2C address of the sources When numDetected > 0, indicates UB960 EVM is initialized. When numDetected == 0, indicates UB960 EVM did not detect any sources. Please check the I2C addresses in case a source was connected but not detected.

Field Documentation

UInt32 BspUtils_Ub960SourceI2cAddr::numSource

Specify the number of sensor/modules connected to UB960

UInt32 BspUtils_Ub960SourceI2cAddr::rSlave1Addr[BSPUTILS_UB960EVM_MAX_PORTS]

Designate the 7 bit slave address for first slave. In cases where TIDA00262 is connected, this holds serializer slave address

UInt32 BspUtils_Ub960SourceI2cAddr::rSlave2Addr[BSPUTILS_UB960EVM_MAX_PORTS]

Designate the 7 bit slave address for second slave. In cases where TIDA00262 is connected, this holds sensor slave address

UInt32 BspUtils_Ub960SourceI2cAddr::slaveAddr

Specify the 7bit UB960 slave address
